content:
Hi all! I'd like to invite you to today's talk at the Cambridge Category Theory Seminar (@2:15 pm GMT). Our speaker is Dr. Luca Reggio (University of Oxford).
Title: A characterisation of the category of compact Hausdorff spaces
You can find the details here: http://talks.cam.ac.uk/talk/index/158035

The next talk will be Tuesday (25/05) at 16:15 pm BST (=GMT+1). Our speaker this time is Martti Karvonen (University of Ottawa).

Title: Categorical composable cryptography

Details (including Zoom data) can be found here: http://talks.cam.ac.uk/talk/index/160660

I'm happy to announce another talk for next Tuesday (01/06), at 4:15 pm BST (=GMT+1). Our speaker will be Valeria de Paiva (Topos Institute).

Title: Categorical Models of Explicit Substitutions

Details (including Zoom data) can be found here: http://talks.cam.ac.uk/talk/index/160855

By the way, is this seminar organized by DPMMS, computer science, or both? I'm curious about what's going on with category theory in Cambridge now that Martin Hyland has retired in maths and Jamie Vicary has gotten a job there in computer science.

This is the DPMMS seminar. There's a separate seminar in the computer science theory group, which is organised by Jamie Vicary (some of the past talks have been uploaded on the OWLS YouTube channel), though it's been inactive recently, and it's not exclusively category theory.

I've been organising them since Tamara left, but it will likely be over once I graduate (hopefully in a few months); as far as I know all the category theory in Cambridge will be left to the Computer Lab, as both PTJ and Hyland are retired and I'm the last student.

José Siqueira said:

I've been organising them since Tamara left

Where&when did Tamara go?
Roughly 2 years ago. I haven't spoken to her in a while, but last time I had news she had some nice industry job

Alexander Campbell said:

José Siqueira said:

I've been organising them since Tamara left

Where&when did Tamara go?

I believe she works at DeepMind now.

The next category theory seminar will be next Tuesday (08/06) at 10 am BST (=GMT+1). My apologies for the time, but it can't be helped --- our speaker this time is Richard Garner (Macquarie University).

Title: Cartesian differential categories as skew enriched categories

Details can be found in http://talks.cam.ac.uk/talk/index/160930 .
